    Classify karyotype and multiplicity Purity estimates

Classify mutations using a (Beta-)Binomial model-based test.

Source: R/run_classifier.R
run_classifier.Rd

Classify mutations using a (Beta-)Binomial model-based test.

Usage

run_classifier(
  x,
  cutoff = 0.75,
  model = "Binomial",
  rho = 0.01,
  karyotypes = c("1:0", "1:1", "2:0", "2:1", "2:2")
)

Arguments

x

An object of class 'TAPACLOTH' generated with function init.

cutoff

Likelihood cut-off for class assignment.

model

Model used for the classification task, either "Binomial" (no over-dispersion) or "Beta-Binomial" (over-dispersion included), that will be used as the expected distribution for the number of reads with variant at fixed coverage and purity.

rho

If "Beta-Binomial" model is selected, this parameter tunes the over-dispersion of the expected distribution used for the test.

karyotypes

Karyotypes to be included among the possible classes.

Value

An object of class TAPACLOTH containing the input plus the classification data and paramters.

Examples

x = init(mutations = example_data$data,
         sample = example_data$sample,
         purity = example_data$purity)
x = run_classifier(
    x = x, 
    model = "Beta-Binomial", 
    rho = 0.01,
    karyotypes = c("1:0","1:1","2:0","2:1","2:2")
    )
#>
